note: Ph.D. student at Hokkaido University. Researcher in Computer Vision and Machine Learning.
biography:
I am a master’s student in Computer Science at National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), with research interests in deep learning, particularly large language models (LLMs) and computer vision.

I am passionate about both human and programming languages. I hold a JLPT N1 certification and a TOEIC score of 815, and I am currently learning Korean. On the technical side, I am proficient in Python and JavaScript.

I am eager to leverage my skills and research experience to address real-world challenges through artificial intelligence and contribute to impactful, human-centered technological solutions.

experience.description: During an internship at United Microelectronics Corporation (UMC), an AI-powered system was developed to support technicians in the integration and management of test sheets (検査項目表), with the objective of improving operational efficiency and reducing manual workload in semiconductor manufacturing processes. The project received 2nd place in the internship final presentation, based on evaluation criteria that emphasized system design, technical implementation, and practical applicability. The work involved close collaboration with engineers and cross-functional teams to analyze semiconductor production automation workflows and translate domain-specific requirements into deployable AI-based solutions for real-world manufacturing challenges.
